---
title: ".package-lock.json"
---

## High-level description
This file is a package-lock.json file for a Node.js project, specifically for a Chromium layer in a Lambda function. It contains detailed information about the exact versions of dependencies used in the project, ensuring consistent installations across different environments.

## Dependencies
The file lists the following external libraries or modules used in the project:

| Dependency | Purpose |
|:-----------|:--------|
| base64-js | JavaScript library for base64 encoding/decoding |
| bl | Buffer list: collect buffers and access with a standard readable Buffer interface |
| buffer | Node.js Buffer API for browser |
| chownr | Like `chown -R` |
| end-of-stream | Call a callback when a readable/writable/duplex stream has completed or failed |
| fs-constants | Expose constants from Node's fs module |
| ieee754 | Read/write IEEE754 floating point numbers from/to a Buffer or array-like object |
| inherits | Browser-friendly inheritance fully compatible with standard node.js inherits() |
| mkdirp-classic | Recursively mkdir, like `mkdir -p` |
| once | Run a function exactly one time |
| pump | Pipe streams together and close all of them if one of them closes |
| readable-stream | Streams3, a user-land copy of the stream library from Node.js |
| safe-buffer | Safer Node.js Buffer API |
| string_decoder | The string_decoder module from Node core |
| tar-fs | Filesystem bindings for tar-stream |
| tar-stream | tar-stream is a streaming tar parser and generator |
| util-deprecate | Node.js's util.deprecate() function with browser support |
| wrappy | Callback wrapping utility |

Each dependency is listed with its exact version, resolved URL, and integrity hash. Some dependencies also include funding information for supporting the developers.

## Configuration
This file does not contain explicit configuration options. It's a lock file that specifies exact versions and integrity hashes for each dependency, ensuring reproducible builds.

## Notes
1. The `lockfileVersion` is 3, indicating this is a newer format of package-lock.json.
2. Some packages (like `base64-js`, `buffer`, `ieee754`, and `safe-buffer`) include funding information, encouraging users to support the developers.
3. The dependencies form a tree structure, with some packages depending on others (e.g., `buffer` depends on `base64-js` and `ieee754`).
4. This lock file ensures that every install of the project will use the exact same versions of dependencies, preventing inconsistencies between different environments or installations.
